org.zaproxy.zap.spider.parser

Class SpiderParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.zaproxy.zap.spider.parser.SpiderParser
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpiderGitParser, SpiderHtmlFormParser, SpiderHtmlParser, SpiderODataAtomParser, SpiderRedirectParser, SpiderRobotstxtParser, SpiderSitemapXMLParser, SpiderSVNEntriesParser, SpiderTextParser

    public abstract class SpiderParser
extends Object
    The Abstract Class SpiderParser is the base for parsers used by the spider. The main purpose of these Parsers is to find links (uris) to resources in the provided content. Uses the Jericho Library for parsing.

      • parseResource

        public abstract boolean parseResource(HttpMessage message,
                                      net.htmlparser.jericho.Source source,
                                      int depth)
        Parses the resource. The HTTP message containing the request and the response is given. Also, if possible, a Jericho source with the Response Body is provided.

        When a link is encountered, implementations can use processURL(HttpMessage, int, String, String), notifyListenersPostResourceFound(HttpMessage, int, String, String) and notifyListenersResourceFound(HttpMessage, int, String) to announce the found URIs.

        The return value specifies whether the resource should be considered 'completely processed'/consumed and should be treated accordingly by subsequent parsers. For example, any parsers which are meant to be 'fall-back' parsers should skip messages already processed by other parsers.

        Parameters:
        message - the full http message containing the request and the response
        source - a Jericho source with the Response Body from the HTTP message. This parameter can be null, in which case the parser implementation should ignore it.
        depth - the depth of this resource
        Returns:
        whether the resource is considered to be exhaustively processed

      • canParseResource

        public abstract boolean canParseResource(HttpMessage message,
                                         String path,
                                         boolean wasAlreadyConsumed)
        Checks whether the parser should be called to parse the given HttpMessage.

        Based on the specifics of the HttpMessage and whether this message was already processed by another Parser, this method should decide whether the parseResource(HttpMessage, Source, int) should be invoked.

        The wasAlreadyConsumed could be used by parsers which represent a 'fall-back' parser to check whether any other parser has processed the message before.

        Parameters:
        message - the full http message containing the request and the response
        path - the resource path, provided for convenience
        wasAlreadyConsumed - if the resource was already parsed by another SpiderParser
        Returns:
        true, if the parseResource(HttpMessage, Source, int) should be invoked.
